definition: to go/to visit (e.g. another country)/to attend (a banquet etc)

sentences.english: The notables then went away, and on the third day they all came with shaved heads.
sentences.chinese: 宴會散了，可第三天那些名人顯貴都剃了光頭來赴宴。

sentences.english: Prof. Li was invited to a banquet after the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 開完會以後，李教授被邀請赴宴。

sentences.english: ACCEPT】She asked me to go to the party and I accepted her invitation.
sentences.chinese: 他請我去赴宴，而我也接受了她的邀請。

sentences.english: We freshened up before going to the party.
sentences.chinese: 在赴宴前我們梳理了一下。

sentences.english: When flatterers meet, the devil goes to dinner.
sentences.chinese: 馬屁精會面，魔鬼赴赴宴。

sentences.english: Invite include front yard of higher primary school inside the celebrity inside the industry attends the banquet.
sentences.chinese: 邀請包括高小庭在內的行業內的名人赴宴。

sentences.english: E. g. : I have no time for such frivolities as parties.
sentences.chinese: 我沒時間去赴宴或參加諸如此類的無聊活動。

sentences.english: When flatterers meet, the devil goes to dinner.
sentences.chinese: 馬屁精會面，魔鬼去赴宴。

sentences.english: So Lü invited both Liu Bei and Ji Ling to a bqnqet.
sentences.chinese: 於是，呂布讓人把劉備和紀靈同時請來赴宴。

sentences.english: Before the dinner he knew next to nothing about Fosun.
sentences.chinese: 赴宴前，達尼埃羅對復星幾乎一無所知。

sentences.english: If invited to someone's house for dinner, don't be one of he ungrateful fed.
sentences.chinese: 如果應邀到某人家中赴宴，別吃了還不領情。

sentences.english: I don't know why John didn't come for the dinner.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道約翰爲什麼今天沒有來赴宴。

sentences.english: Mr. Bowen and Mr. Dewey are invited to a dinner at the Sichuan restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 伯恩先生和杜威先生應邀去四川飯店赴宴。

definition: to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
to hold a welcoming dinner or reception
congratulate an elderly person on his birthday/offer birthday felicitations
to greet/to go out to meet
to give a dinner party/to entertain guests/to invite to dinner
to do sb the honor (of attending etc)/to put in an appearance/to show up
to call to pay one's respect/to call on
